definition: death/to pass away (of Buddhist monks, nuns etc)
circle/round/circular/spherical/(of the moon) full/unit of Chinese currency (yuan)/tactful/to make consistent and whole (the narrative of a dream or a lie)

sentences.english: That was to help maintain the veil of secrecy surrounding the death of his predecessor.
sentences.chinese: 這樣做可以保持籠罩在他圓寂前任周圍的神祕氛圍。

sentences.english: It was used as burial ground for monks of temple after cremation .
sentences.chinese: 是寺僧圓寂火化後靈骨的墓葬地。

sentences.english: There is a very brief sutra dealing with the Great Decease in the Samyutta Nikaya.
sentences.chinese: 在雜阿含經中有一個非常簡短的佛經談到圓寂。

sentences.english: The old monk passed away in the Buddhist temple.
At early dawn he turned on his right side with his head to the north, and died.
sentences.chinese: 在黎明，他轉過右側面的頭朝向北方，接着圓寂了。

sentences.english: I realize now, after her death, what wise advice that is.
sentences.chinese: 她圓寂以後，我才分明到，那是多麼明智的創議啊。

definition: Sakyamuni Buddha (Sanskrit: sage of the Sakya)/Siddhartha Gautama (563-485 BC), the historical Buddha and founder of Buddhism
virtuous achievements come to their successful conclusion (idiom)
another name for Sakyamuni 釋迦牟尼佛|释迦牟尼佛, the historical Buddha
(Buddhism) to initiate sb for monkhood or nunhood
to transmit Buddhist teaching/chakram or chakka (throwing disk)
Buddha Kassapa (Pāli) or Kāśyapa (Skt) (one of the Buddhas of the past)
to die of old age/to live to a ripe old age/(fig.) (of sth) to come to an end (after a long period of service)
Manjushri, the Bodhisattva of keen awareness
boundless life (expression of good wishes)/Amitayus, the Buddha of measureless life, good fortune and wisdom
(of a deity) to take a material shape/to appear
